intro: Hibbertia podocarpifolia, commonly known as the mountain hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, often in sandstone regions. The plant features yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, with hairy stems and leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Hibbertia podocarpifolia is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
